text: Pros: - Work with a young population, everyone is agile, smart and energetic. - Team up with APAC regions and other countries for globalised projects, such as HK, Singapore, Malaysia, Dubai, U.S., and many more. - A large degree of autonomy to lead projects, to learn from each other and to grow together. - Very attractive and competitive company benefits, including learning fund, gym allowance and meal benefits. It's a company with Work/Life Balance and Growth Mindset.. Cons: -

post_title: Good benefits but still a long way to become truly international in workplace
text: Pros: Good benefits such as meal allowance, nice working environment, most colleagues are nice and helpful, a fast-moving business nature that pushes everyone to be more competitive which is good for personal growth. Cons: Still not capable to manage teams in a corporate way, some ideas are outdated or far behind the market general expectation. Still have much more room to improve.

post_title: Excellent pay and employee benefits with moderate work life balance
text: Pros: Excellent pay and employee benefits with moderate work life balance. Cons: As a software developer in this company, mandarin speaking skill is preferable, however this is improving gradually as the firm is going international.

post_title: Worst company in my career. I‚Äôm ashamed I worked here.
text: Pros: The design team is strong, insightful, and compassionate. Teammates believe in the crypto economy and are very knowledgeable in the field.. Cons: You will be treated with disrespect by those close to the CEO. You are a resource which is expected to have no opinion, do what you‚Äôre told, and work long hours. You will watch your teammates become anxious and riddled with life-long health problems. You will notice everyone with an opinion gets fired. You will become a pessimist. The stock options are worthless.

post_title: A company ran on corporate slavery
text: Pros: Nothing at all. If you are based in hongkong, you probably get paid twice as much as a similar role in Beijing. but does this count as Pros?. Cons: The only reason you are hired is to carry the blame of your incompetent boss one day, they make all kinds of stupid decisions and yet still survives, the guy who made the BCH fork incident is still working over there and is still in charge, they make unrealistic goal and force feed you that goal that saying anything else is blasphemy. The payment is so unfair that for a same role HongKong is paid twice as much as their Beijing team. You basically have to obey every command from your boss to get paid, no matter how stupid that command is. and he will be very pissed if you tell him that he is wrong.

post_title: Challenging and promising, full of possibilities
text: Pros: This is a fast-moving company with things constantly involving. Some people might find it too difficult to adapt to, but I believe this is the perfect mode for an ever-changing industry. Changes bring opportunities, and you can try things that you wouldn't dare or imagine to do in the past. This is one of the biggest benefit, in my opinion. The company creates a platform for people to grow and shine, as long as you are prepared. Literally speaking, impossible is nothing, and the sky is the limit. People around you are young, energetic, fun and down-to-earth. It is rare to find this type of environment in Hong Kong. Management is straight-forward and understanding. They have high hopes and tight delivery schedule, but don't make impossible demands. Also, say goodbye to the bureaucracy that drives many talents crazy in the traditional banking industry. In OKEx, everyone is working towards the same goal and you can really feel the energy. Although there are still issues around internal processes and still much can be improved, overall it is moving on the right track at the right speed.. Cons: Communication channels, either top-down or bottom-up, could be improved, and it is important to further bolster the sense of belonging among the employees, especially the junior ones.
Pros: Great exchange. Great mission. Great people. Cons: Management could have been more flexible

Pros: good office location with free drinks and snacks. Cons: Very poor management and gossip everywhere. You could see some nice colleagues, but others are neither professional nor friendly. Some would even discriminate you because you lack some sort of experience or are just not their cup of tea (so why you hire such an employee). No one knows what to do next. No work life balance.
Pros: Valuable experience for resume High-profile position. Cons: No sick days, they come from vacation

post_title: Amazing team and people, prospective industry
text: Pros: People are very friendly and nice here, they are hard-working, dedicate and really love the industry. I blended in the team really quickly because of their warm welcome. There is a strong culture of learning and development here, people are always happy to answer your questions and provide insights, many trainings and workshops, one of the most extensive orientation I have ever had, quite engaging and learnt a lot. Excited to join this company.. Cons: Things could get a bit confusing at times, so you need to ask questions a lot, but people are happy to help. It's not uncommon that in a tech company things change a lot, so if you are looking for a standard corporate job without any proactiveness then this might not be your cup of tea.
Pros: -. Cons: As a user, the company's product UI can be improved
Pros: Pays ok money. Nothing else.. Cons: Bad culture with people not caring about their work yet getting all the perks because they know how to please the management. Happens across every team.

Pros: As an employee who has worked at OKEx for 3 years, I have gained and grown a lot. I joined this company because I love this industry. My first impression is that in similar industries, its salary is significantly higher than other companies. There are also many opportunities for promotion in the work process. Each person has 2 chances of promotion and salary increase every year. This company attaches great importance to the abilities of its employees. The position and salary must match your abilities, and the company is willing to contribute a lot of resources to help each employee improve their abilities in all aspects. In addition, every colleague in the company is very friendly, and there has never been any unpleasant things between us. The company often organizes tours,,various sports clubs, etc., also prepares birthday gifts and holiday gifts for us. Leaders are very nice.. Cons: overtime is definitely inevitable. It is necessary to have a certain degree of stress resistance. OKR and KPI will be ordered periodically, and work efficiency needs to be very high. I am very fortunate to be able to join such a humane and warm company.
Pros: Nice office location and view. Cons: Bad management, no leadership, no planning, no training, no direction, no respect, even management doesn‚Äôt know what to do next
